Posts.Content: Nov 25, 2011 04:30PM LynnCS wrote: Thanks for your reply.  I saw my MO and he's prescribed Emend for the next treatments.  Did you have any side effects from Emend? The pharmacist told me "it can cause upset stomach"  LOL!  I just stared at him and said "You're kidding! Anti-nausea medicine that causes upset stomach? What's the point of taking it then, especially at this price?"  Haha!  So I don't know ...  On the plus side I feel much better the second week and enjoyed our Thanksgiving dinner .. tho' my taste buds were not cooperating.  Hope you are doing well.
Posts.Title: Taxotere/Cytoxan ~ Nausea/Vomiting LynnCS SusanGA

Posts.Content: LynnCS wrote: I had my first tx of TC last week. They put Aloxi in at the time and that lasted four days.  I had no real nausea so I didn't take the Compazine but I was vomiting every 2-3 hours until I could finally keep one down.  My question is how long does the nausea typically last ~ a few days? ~ longer? ~ the entire 21 days until the next tx? I stayed well-hydrated up to now and I don't want to lose ground.  My poor family! With Thanksgiving next week! :( Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Taxotere/Cytoxan ~ Nausea/Vomiting LynnCS SusanGA

Posts.Content: LynnCS wrote: I recently was diagnosed with DCIS and after consulting with a surgeon opted for a mastectomy and sentinel node biopsy. The SN tested positive 1/2; negative for extranodal extension. the surgeon then did a axillary contenet excision - the results were 0/11. [There was  invasive ductal carcinoma in a separate area of the breast 1.2cm, tumor grade-II of III (tubule formation -3, nucear atypia -2, mitotic activity-1; necrosis-absent]  I have an appointment with an oncologist but I am confused and want to sound halfway intelligent when I talk to him? Anyone who can shed some light would be appreciated! Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: 1 Positive sentinel node~What's next? LynnCS donnad333

Posts.Content: Oct 23, 2011 09:25PM LynnCS wrote: Yes I have the pathology report and there are clean margins. And I mentoned I had an appointment with an oncologist but are you saying there is a medical oncologist I should consider seeing? My confusion comes from all the contradictory advice I've seen and read ~ I just want to make an intelligent decision based on the oncologist's best advice.  But I desperately hope he listens to me without playing down my concerns and other health issues,  I went into this expecting to lose a boob and it really threw me for a loop when the surgeon said 1/2 sentinel nodes was positive.  She then took 11 more axillary nodes (I misspelled content in the first message) they were negative. Hope this clarifies things.  I'm not thinking too clearlythese days! :(
Posts.Title: 1 Positive sentinel node~What's next? LynnCS donnad333
